To prevent high circulating currents between paralleled alternators, the following conditions should be met:

options.content: their voltage and frequency must be the same
their frequencies must be identical and their phase sequence must be the same
their voltage, frequency, phase and phase sequence must all be the same
their inductive and capacitive reactances must match exactly

options.content: provides for initial excitation of the field
controls the amount of excitation in the stator windings
provides the initial excitation in the voltage regulator
can be flashed by the application of alternating current

questions.question: Voltage control of an alternator output is achieved by varying the:
Frequency wild AC is produced when:

options.content: the rotational speed of the generator varies

questions.question: In a star connected supply system:

options.content: line and phase current are equal
line current is greater than phase current
line current is less than phase current
phase current is 0.707 times line current

One advantage of three phase generation over single phase generation is that:

options.content: most aircraft services require a three phase supply
it can be more easily transformed into DC
it gives more compact generators and allows lower cable weights
the power factor is much lower

options.content: its field excitation fed directly to the armature

options.content: cause a large current to flow in the neutral
have no effect on the other phases
cause a reduction in the frequency of the supply

A voltage regulator works by:

options.content: assessing the impedance of the circuit

questions.question: To ensure correct load sharing on paralleled alternators:

options.content: both real and reactive loads should be balanced
actual loads should be the same
reactive loads should be the same
the load impedance should be constant

questions.question: Reactive load sharing is achieved by:

options.content: altering the loads on the bus bars

questions.question: Real load sharing is achieved by:

options.content: altering the loads on the bus bar

questions.question: The phase relationship of paralleled generators should be:
In a constant speed parallel operation alternator system:

options.content: each alternator has its own constant speed drive unit
all engines are run at the same speed
all alternators are driven by the same engine
engine speed is governed by the constant speed drive unit

questions.question: An aircraftˊs constant frequency supply is maintained at:
For a modern aircraft powered by an AC system, the ground power unit must supply:
Oil for the operation of a CSDU is:

options.content: supplied from the engine oil system
drawn from a common tank for all CSDUs

questions.question: Malfunction of a CSDU requires:

options.content: automatic electrical disconnection of the drive at any time in flight
that the input drive will shear on the ground only
operation of the drive disconnect switch at any time in flight
operation of the drive disconnect switch on the ground only

questions.question: Before two constant frequency AC generators can be connected in parallel:

options.content: their frequency, phase, phase sequence and voltage must match, and a means of automatic real and reactive load sharing must be available
real and reactive loads must match. Frequency, phase and voltage must be within limits
the synchronization lights on the alternator control panel must be fully bright
suitable control arrangements must exist for the sharing of real and reactive loads. These will correct any phase or frequency error existing at the time of connection

questions.question: The generator control relay (GCR) is:

options.content: between the alternator and its load bus bar
between the load bus bar and the synchronous bus bar

questions.question: The running excitation current for an alternator is:

options.content: DC which is rectified AC and could be from a separate excitation generator on the main rotor shaft

questions.question: If each phase of a three phase star wound system has a phase voltage of 115 volts, the voltage obtained by bridging two phase would be:
Protection from ˋearthˊ faults and ˋline to lineˊ faults is given by:

options.content: a fault protection system including a differential protection monitor

questions.question: Warnings of CSDU oil overheat are given in the cockpit by:
One disadvantage of parallel operation is that:

options.content: faults can propagate, and any error in supply can affect all services
the system is less flexible due to the need for additional control and protection circuits
the greater load on the CSDUs means that their power / weight ratio is much reduced
there is a considerable increase in complexity compared with a non-paralleled system, due to the need for CSDUs and load sharing circuits

questions.question: Alternators in parallel operation require the maintenance of constant frequency and phase synchronization to:

options.content: balance the battery voltage when more than one battery is being used

questions.question: The APU generator can only be used when:

options.content: the aircraft is on the ground
the bus bars are being fed from another source
when no other power source is feeding the bus bar

questions.question: The purpose of the differential protection circuit in a three phase AC system is:

options.content: to compare alternator output current to bus bar current
to compare on and off load currents
to compare the alternators reactive load to its real load
to compare the CSDU efficiency ratings

questions.question: An alternator driven by a CSDU

options.content: will require a lubrication system separated from its drive oil system
will not require a voltage controller

questions.question: In the event of a mechanical malfunction of the alternator:

options.content: the drive disconnect unit will automatically separate the CSDU from the alternator
the real load will be adjusted to compensate
the CSDU oil temperature will decrease

questions.question: The load meter, upon selection to “kVAR” would indicate:
Disconnection of the CSDU in flight would be advisable if:

options.content: the frequency meter indicated a discrepancy of greater than 5 Hz between alternators
there was an over or under voltage
the oil temperature was high or the oil pressure was low

questions.question: To increase the real load taken by a paralleled AC generator, the:

options.content: generator drive torque and field excitation are increased
generator voltage regulator adjusts the generator rotor torque

questions.question: Load sharing circuits are necessary whenever:

options.content: the ground power and the APU are serving the bus bars together

questions.question: Paralleled alternators will have:

options.content: one load meter which measures total system load
one load meter for each alternator
one meter which indicates both voltage and frequency

questions.question: Frequency controlled generators are:

options.content: paralleled only when the DC is paralleled

questions.question: If the CSDU drive disconnect unit has been used, the drive can:

options.content: only be reconnected when the aircraft is on the ground
be reinstated in flight from the electrical supply department
be reinstated in flight from the flight deck
be reinstated when necessary by using the Ram Air Turbine

questions.question: When selected to ˋkWˊ, the alternator load meter will indicate the:
An AC generatorˊs IDU oil system:

options.content: is common with the engine oil system

questions.question: An alternator driven by a non-integrated constant speed drive unit, has windings that are cooled by:
The load in a paralleled AC system is measured in:
Paralleled generators must share real and reactive loads:

options.content: to prevent large current flows through the TRUs
to prevent out of balance forces being fed through the CSDUs to the engines
to prevent large flows of current from one generator to another
to prevent harmonic frequencies being created in the synchronous bus bars

questions.question: One advantage of running alternators in parallel is that:

options.content: the supply to all circuits is in phase
a large capacity is available to absorb heavy transient loads when switching of heavy currents occurs
the risk of overloading the system is reduced
there is only a requirement for one CSDU

questions.question: When an external AC supply is feeding the bus bars:

options.content: the internal bus bars are disconnected
the aircraft generators are run in parallel with the external supply
the aircraft generators are taken off line
the synchronizing unit will ensure that no frequency difference exists between the aircraft generators and the external supply

questions.question: A three phase AC system can be used to supply:

options.content: both one or three phase equipment

questions.question: In a frequency wild generation system:

options.content: generators can be run in parallel only when all engine RPMs match
generators can never be run in parallel and there can be no duplication of supply
generators can never be run in parallel, but after rectification, the DC can be fed to a common bus bar to provide a redundancy of supply
capacitive and inductive loads can be fed with no problems of overheating

questions.question: A fault on one phase of a three phase AC star connected system would:
The purpose of an inverter is:

options.content: to change the frequency of the AC supply
to act as a back up for the alternator

questions.question: A low reactive load on one generator is compensated for by:

options.content: altering the excitation current flowing in its field circuit
increasing the real load on the other generators

questions.question: I n the event of a mechanical failure occurring in the generator, the CSDU is protected by:
To increase the real load which is being taken by a paralleled alternator:

options.content: the voltage regulator adjusts the generator rotor torque
both its drive torque and its excitation are increased

questions.question: An earth fault on a bus bar of a parallel generator system:

options.content: would require that the appropriate GCB should open
would require that the appropriate BTB should open
would require that both the appropriate GCB and BTB should open
would require that all alternators should operate independently
